primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God rescues a world in bondage to decay and death through the sacrifice of Christ, transforming enemies into a holy temple (the church) to manifest His glory.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically 'God, who is rich in mercy')
tekstueel_bewijs: God... made us alive together with Christ
God mercifully withheld such punishment from us
God is bringing to pass [the unity of the church]

object.identificatie: The rescue and transformation of humanity ('the praise of his glory')
tekstueel_bewijs: the story of the gradual renewal of a man
the story of our passing from one world into another
a dwelling place of God in the Spirit
according to the riches of his grace which he lavished upon us

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Children of Wrath' / The World / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: we were by nature children of wrath
the human race is deserving of condemnation
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of an unmerited rescue.

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: Christ Jesus himself being the cornerstone
dwelling place of God in the Spirit
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Helper in the rescue.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power that builds the 'holy temple'.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the Devil ('Principalities and Powers')
tekstueel_bewijs: principalities... powers... world rulers of this present darkness
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but an ontological 'bondage' and 'death' that requires rescue from 'beyond this sphere'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church (saved humanity) acting as a 'beachhead' for God's reclamation project in the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / Christian Soldiers
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Unity, deeds of love, and standing against darkness
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/mission) is explicitly the result of the primary program (salvation). We are 'Saved (P1) FOR (P2)'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Mercy → Redemption/Transformation → Children of Wrath
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God → The Praise of His Glory (via the Church)

voorbeelden_mens_subject: we keep falling back on ungodly weapons

voorbeelden: beg you to lead a life worthy
we don’t sufficiently know how to do it
grace of God is capable of making us holy
be strong in the Lord and in the strength of his might

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes that human 'doing' (Devoir) is impossible without the 'power' (Pouvoir) granted by Grace.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (Bronx murders), rejects ~S2 (denial), moves to S1 (Ephesians 2), and warns against ~S1 (McVeigh execution logic).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in S1: Grace is the only power capable of moving a subject from S2 to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; uses graphic examples of murder to establish the necessity of rescue.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently maintains God as the primary actor. Even when calling for action, it frames the church as a 'dwelling place' for God's action rather than an independent agent.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: summons to all of us Christian soldiers to stand our ground

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Rescue must come from beyond. And that is exactly what has happened.
Grace is undeserved: that is the whole point.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples; rather, the Church is described as a corporate body being acted upon by God.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon treats Lazarus/Raskolnikov as recipients of life, not models of effort.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and gratitude leading to organic participation.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation leading to synergistic sanctification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from 'Saved!' to 'Saved for what?' perfectly preserves the hierarchy of Soteriology over Ethics.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'hypocritical' reality of the church and its 'holy' status in Christ.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: redemption through his blood... stand against the wiles of the devil

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (power) for the church to function.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total; humanity is 'dead' and 'children of wrath' without intervention.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's mercy. The human subject only appears as an active agent in the secondary program, and even then, only as a 'part' of a body moved by the 'Head' (Christ).

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Devoir in the middle section regarding 'working properly'.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current emphasis on Pouvoir (God's ability).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue to ground the 'must' of unity in the 'is' of Christ's work.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already avoids 'light' opponents by citing real-world murder and cosmic darkness.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented preaching. It addresses the 'what now?' of the Christian life without ever turning the Gospel into a 'to-do' list, keeping the focus on God's ongoing reclamation project.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the use of Dostoevsky or the Bronx examples to move the audience, Greimasian analysis shows these are actantial markers of the 'Opponent' and the 'Receiver'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Ephesians 4; this analysis shows how the sermon's 'grammar' actually functions as a delivery system for the text's theology.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Church' is a secondary subject whose competence is entirely derived from the primary Subject (God).

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully navigates the 'Rutledge Rule' by making God the subject of the most critical transformative verbs.
